snippet: The California Department of Water Resources priced $180 million in tax-exempt water-system revenue bonds yesterday through competitive bidding won by a group of underwriters led by Dillon, Read & Company.   Underwriters said the issue offered inv...
lead_paragraph: The California Department of Water Resources priced $180 million in tax-exempt water-system revenue bonds yesterday through competitive bidding won by a group of underwriters led by Dillon, Read & Company. Underwriters said the issue offered investors a maximum yield of 6.841 percent for a bond due 2019. For shorter maturities, serial bonds are priced to yield from 4.5 percent in 1992 to 5.6 percent in 1996, 6.15 percent in 2001, 6.6 percent in 2006 and 6.8 percent in 2011.
